required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Appendicitis During the National Lockdown During the COVID-19 Pandemic
clinical_study.official_title: Change in the Incidence of Appendicitis in a Controlled Environment During the National Lockdown Throughout the COVID-19 Pandemic

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to examine whether a nationwide lock-down with an entire population subjugated to social distancing reduces the incidence of appendicitis. If a reduction is detected it supports the hypothesis that infectious disease may play a role in the etiology of appendicitis.

primary_outcome.description: Appendectomy or other surgery for appendicitis

intervention.description: Lock-down and social distancing during COVID-19 pandemic

study_pop.textblock: All persons registered in the Danish National Patient Register, i.e. all persons resident in Denmark

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Registered in the Danish National Patient Register during the study period
Exclusion Criteria:
None
